artist_books.general_description: Hand printed, signed and bound by the artist. Printed onto Somerset velvet paper 250 gms with archival inks. The artist book lends itself well to the adaption and exploration of sequential narrative story telling.

items.title: Gods & Monsters
items.medium: Linocut, wood block & Letterpress, hardback cover concertina book
items.narrative: A large format alphabet book illustrating the surreal creatures and spiritual powers of the mighty legendary Gods and mythical beasts from the underworld. Inspired by Ovid’s Metamorphosis, Greek Mythology and childhood memories. Themes include the fusion of villain and hero (Picasso’s Minotaur), the passage of life, and good versus evil.

items.title: Journeyman
items.medium: Etching & Letterpress, hardback cover concertina book
items.narrative: Inspired by a surreal dream and the universal idea of the journeyman. The labyrinth represents the twists and turns of modern life. Symbols include the jellyfish (rescue/care) and the dream catcher. Themes: life’s excitements, fears and dangers. A story that does not end: it evolves with the times.

items.title: Run
items.medium: Linocut, Letterpress, and collage, ½ bound hardback cover
items.narrative: An exploration of sayings and expressions inspired by contemporary life. Machines are taking over. Glances at how media runs news, politicians run lives, and fake news runs away with facts. Themes: Technology, corruption, and control.

items.title: Future
items.medium: Linocut, Letterpress, and collage, hardback cover
items.narrative: Created in a time of great uncertainty. Parallels seen between superpowers (Kim Jong-un, Trump, Putin). Themes: Nuclear threat, greed, power corruption, and global communication manipulation. 'The Future is now.'

items.title: Crack’s Progress / Charlie’s Progress
items.medium: Offset lithograph from scaled down original linocuts, hardback cover dos a dos artist book
items.narrative: Two tales in one book. Crack's Progress: A modern fable based on Hogarth’s A Rake’s Progress; a tale of drugs, crime, prison, and Bedlam. Charlie's Progress: Based on Hogarth’s A Harlot’s Progress; follows Crack's sister Charlie through London's low life, exploitation, and eventual recovery.

items.title: Modern Marriage
items.medium: Offset lithograph & Letterpress, hardback cover with screen printed band
items.narrative: Interweaves the 'Progress' stories. Tara (rich) and Darren (nouveau riche) marry. Themes: Debt, crime, neglect (their child Wayne), and ultimate tragedy followed by redemption through siblings Crack and Charlie.

items.title: Contemporary Street Alphabet
items.narrative: An alphabet book of modern-day street characters with text by Pat Francis. A savage portrayal of the city, depicting victims and perpetrators, horror and humour.

ceramics.general_description: Sculptural forms in stoneware clay with brush-on slips, glazes, and oxides. Narratives wrap around the object. Each piece is a one-off.

items.title: Afterlife
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Inspired by the Mexican Day of the Dead. Skeletons act as gatekeepers for the passageway to the afterlife.

items.title: Azrael
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Angel of death, keeper of fire. Linking into the Inferno series. Infiltrating lives and meals.

items.title: Bala
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: The next terrible storm is named. Spinning and raging, destroying all in its path.

items.title: Burn in hell
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Links to Inferno prints. Circular theme of the bowl suits the endless chase. Witches, boiling water, trapped souls.

items.title: Chaos
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: From chaos was the world created. Void, swirling wind, rising sea levels. Mankind must learn that Gods can cleanse the earth.

items.title: Lockdown
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Relates to Persons and Personas prints. Depicts characters incarcerated in El Salvador prisons. Violence, betrayal, no hope of salvation.

items.title: Superpowers
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Superpowers' fights are big versions of spats. Social media, fake news, nuclear buttons.

items.title: Medusa
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Concepts of eating and glazing (Medusa's gaze). Open mouths invite consumption, but it is 'hell on a plate'. Warning of gluttony.

items.title: Rocket man
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Rocketman circles the earth. Reference to Hiroshima bombs and modern ego threats of superpowers.

items.title: Safe passage
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Rivers run slow with hot lava. The ferry man guides souls through darkness closer to hell.

items.title: Fish car
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: Playful take on genetic manipulation. A hybrid that can't run or swim, pegged down in a tile.

items.title: Freedom
items.medium: underglaze painting, oxides and clear glaze finish
items.narrative: The war has ended, but wounds are open. Political leaders deciding impossible solutions. Freedom must prevail.

print_collections.description: Inspired by Hogarth’s A Harlot’s Progress. Follows Charlie (Crack's sister) and her sister Tara through London's dark low life.

works.title: Conceived in a summer of love
To be safe in the city

print_collections.description: A modern fable of dark morality, crime and corruption. Follows Crack and his dog Spike.

works.title: To be bad he became bad

print_collections.description: Inhabitants of towns/cities, living in light or lurking in shadows. Themes of urban decay, corruption, and vice.

works.title: After Hours
works.narrative: Too much to drink, rats come out to play.

works.title: Angel of Victory
works.narrative: A fighter, a carer inside a mask. True victory is caring for the carers.

works.title: Early hours of the morning
works.narrative: Underworld spreads its tentacles. Prisoners break out, judges play away.

works.title: Laying down the Law in Lager Lane and Lifting the Spirits in Tonic Row
works.narrative: Inspired by Hogarth’s 'Gin Lane'. Commentary on consumerist society, alcohol, and shady lawyers.

works.title: Metamorphosis
works.narrative: Inspired by Kafka. A man morphs into a creature through cosmetic surgery.

works.title: Time is just an illusion
works.narrative: ‘Work for bones’. The tramp watches the world go by.

works.title: Nightcap
works.narrative: One for the road. Corruption lurks in dark corners.

works.title: Getting Weighed In
works.narrative: Politicians and gangsters weighing up the odds on corrupted scales.

works.title: Self-made man
works.narrative: My word stands for all. Cross my path and there will be no more words.

works.title: Gangsters - Contracted
works.narrative: Step into the arena. One step too far.

works.title: Gangsters - Driven
works.narrative: The engine fires. Point of no return.

works.title: Gangsters - Wacked
works.narrative: Footsteps in darkness. Finger on the trigger. BANG.

works.title: Gangsters - Busted
works.narrative: Locked in shackles and sent to the clink.

print_collections.description: Inspired by Hans Holbein’s Dance of Death. A series presented in small volumes. Themes: Behaviors and personality traits vs. Death. 'The dancing skeleton delights in countering the swagger of the individual'.
print_collections.note: Concept description only; individual print specifications not listed in source.

print_collections.description: Rules are carefully constructed, then bent to other purposes.

works.title: Hierarchy of Anarchy
works.narrative: Structure of family relationships within the suit of diamonds.

works.title: Pack of Liars
works.narrative: Satirical portrayal of a corrupt 'royal' family (business magnate king, socialite, drop out heir) controlled by a joker.

works.title: Machiavellian
works.narrative: Inspired by Punch and Judy. The skeleton controls the King and Queen. Political commentary on how citizens are misled by corrupt powers.

print_collections.description: Surreal creatures and mythical beasts from the underworld.
Explores the darker sides of human nature, climate change, and political catastrophes. References Dante’s Inferno.

works.title: The FUTURE
works.narrative: Post-apocalyptic narrative. Rising sea levels, human consumption, and skeletons. 'The FUTURE is now!'

works.title: Fall
works.narrative: Prediction of collapse. 'Fall, Fall, we will all fall'. Economies fail, pandemics rise. 'Look on this and learn'.

works.title: Hell is empty: the devils are all here
works.narrative: Maybe the devils are us? Religion and politics blind us. Rise above the darkness.

works.title: Swamp of indulgent consequences
works.narrative: Earth groans under weight of 'things'. Putrid swamps, storms named after people's lusts.

works.title: Stewpot of Mouldering Morsels
works.narrative: Food mouldering past sell by dates. The stench of corrupted food cycles.

works.title: Hell on Earth
works.narrative: Part man, part beast. Masked officials infiltrate. 'Hell on Earth is now and for ever'.

works.title: The Devils in the Detail
works.narrative: We deal with the devils daily. Our endless online orders and consumption corrode the planet.

works.title: Descent into Darkness
works.narrative: The tree as a gateway. What lies beneath the shaded graveyard?

works.title: The circles of Hell
works.narrative: Work in progress. Inspired by Dante. A lone journeyman wanders through the labyrinth. Sins of gluttony, lust, fraud judged.

works.title: Night Attack
works.narrative: Lords on high soar in skies. Run: don't look up.

works.title: Night Terrors
works.narrative: Guardian angel swoops down. No Mercy. Death stare of Azrael.

works.title: Midnight
works.narrative: Displaced people move during night cover. Air raid sirens wail.

works.title: The War: A Reflection on Power, and Survival
works.narrative: Stark reminder of turbulent times. Echoes German Expressionism. Imagery of underground tunnels. 'Who will have the nerve to push the red button?'

print_collections.description: Surreal dream of the 'everyman'. Labyrinth of modern life.

works.title: Arrival
works.narrative: No name, nor emotion. Arriving, never to return.

works.title: Submerged
works.narrative: Plummeting into darkness. Seeds are sown. Journeyman awakes.

works.title: Secret Doorway
works.narrative: Barren landscape. A doorway looms.

works.title: Labyrinth
works.narrative: Webs are impenetrable. Sunlight will always beam if we let it.

works.title: Confusion
works.narrative: Mixed messages. A moment of clarity: Exit from the maelstrom.

works.title: Darkness
works.narrative: Hell under earth. A lamplight flickers.

works.title: Ascent
works.narrative: Ravening monsters awake. Hope is hatched.

works.title: Eruption
works.narrative: Trees are salvation, but time is running out.

works.title: Departure
works.narrative: Fires burning on earth. Ride the airwaves to safety.

works.title: Metropolis
works.narrative: A safety net protects new life. The dream catcher journeys on.

works.title: Journeyman (Complete Set)
works.narrative: Complete collection of 10 prints.
